creator: peter.moore@dimension4.com
text:
When trying to load a test plan created with version 2.0.3, I get an error that
says: "Unexpected Error - see log for details".

In the log, I see that a class can't be found:
  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
  org.apache.jmeter.protocol.jdbc.config.gui.DbConfigGui

Indeed, in 2.1, ApacheJMeter_jdbc.jar no longer contains that class file, which
was present in 2.0.3.

As an aside: Swapping the 2.0.3 version of this jar file in for the 2.1 version
doesn't give any errors, but, as might be expected, there are ugly errors in the
log, and the test plan only gets partially loaded.

Full error dump from logs:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

	at org.apache.jmeter.gui.action.ActionRouter$1.run(ActionRouter.java:61)
	at java.awt.event.InvocationEvent.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(Unknown Source)

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Looking at CVS shows that there was some re-arrangement in this area, and that
class file was removed.

The DbConfig and Pool Config were merged into the JDBC Connection Configuration
GUI element.

Normally class re-names are dealt with by the upgrade.properties file - not sure
if this can cope with merged classes - will have to investigate further.

This has now been fixed in the 2.1 branch; the 2-1.20050903 nightly build is
available if you want to try it.

However 2 of the JDBC config elements have been merged, and some config items
have disappeared, so some manual tweaking may be required

The fix will be in the 2.1.1 release.
creator: sebb@apache.org
